title: Varieties in Prose
author: Allingham, William
snippet: ' Lover's Lane' has a cemetery wall onone side and a garden wall topt with broken glass on theother, each ten feet high. At the lower end comes one prettypeep of the green Pentlands across a meadowy vale, andthey would have been visible all along the lower roadbut for the endless stone walls of ' Canaan Park,' ' EdenHermitage,' ' Harmony House,' and other mansions. The' Jordan' burn flows through the valley.
